intro: Bupleurum kakiskalae, commonly known as the Kakiskalae angelica, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its rarity and unique ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
